Our serving staff was really friendly too.

My slight criticisms: my fork was a bit dirty still, and the restaurant was a little cold (other diners also noted this).

I hope to be back soon!!

review_text:
I am really disappointed with our most recent visit. This used to be one of our favourite places to catch up, but the experience this time was poor from start to finish.

Even though we had a reservation and arrived early, we still waited about past our booking time to be seated. Partway through our meal we were asked to move our table backwards so a band could set up behind us, even though they did not start playing until right before we left. The music in the restaurant was already very loud, and the setup happening directly behind us made it extremely difficult to have a normal conversation.

Service was slow all evening. There were long delays between dishes, and it was difficult to get anyone’s attention even to order drinks. My mixed meat fajitas cost 24 euro and were disappointing. The chicken portion was very disappointing size wise, and the steak was undercooked. I was not asked how I wanted it cooked, and the staff seemed far too busy to address it.

What made this even more frustrating is that I emailed the restaurant privately on the 21st to share this feedback and never received a reply. After several great visits in the past, this experience and the complete lack of acknowledgement makes me very hesitant to return

formatted_address: Dornan's Yard, The Black Market, Monahan Rd, Ballintemple, Cork, T12 NXN1, Ireland
review_text:
Lovely quiet place compared to the Marina Market.

The big horror themed art pictures on display is a let down though. No need for it. If you're thinking of bringing children in here I'd strongly advise against it.

Also, not too many good options here. The restaurants that are there, from my experiences here, don't offer good quality food. It's mediocre standards. The best place here is Soma. Good coffee & nice snacks (although the snacks are quite pricey).

The Marina Market is better for food quality & more food options, but The Black Market is better to go & chill with nice coffee.

Also, The Black Market isn't open 7 days a week like The Marina Market, which is a little disappointing because I have come here a few times when it was closed.

formatted_address: 5 Pembroke St, Centre, Cork, T12 HD79, Ireland
review_text:
I’m going to be the realest of the real, here. If you’ve had birria before, this is not birria. So set your expectations. Yes, it has the consumé, and that was spot on. But the tacos are absolutely stuffed to the brim with black beans. So that’s all you taste, and is not part of a traditional birria. Went with a party of 2 Americans, 1 Irish American, and 1 Irish - none of us would go back. The food was *fine*. A bit charred. It just wasn’t wow-worthy and wasn’t what we expected. It’s also pricey.

Since it was nearly impossible to tell if there was seating from the listing, I tried to show some of it in my photo here. The service was meh - kind of typical Irish where you’re inconveniencing them by having to do their jobs. No smile or hello or thank you, just glowering.

After all that winging I’ll give my pros, to be fair:

- coldest Coke I’ve had in my life, it was heaven on earth
- consumé was good
- stuffed to the brim, very meat-heavy tacos they weren’t skimping

Wanted a small lunch to tide me over until dinner time. review_text:
Arrived around 8pm on a busy Saturday night. They managed to fit us in without reservation (on a shared table)

Service:
Man with the big beard was excellent, provided great recommendations and was friendly throughout.

Food:

The small plate pork belly was incredible! It literally blew us away with the flavours!!! 5/5

We got two shared plates:
1. Peruvian fried chicken
Slightly salty but had good flavours. Rice was tasty, probably the best part of the dish. All in all, it didn’t wow us. 3/5

2. Seared Prawns
A unique dish, the prawns come cold with carrots, onions and even strawberries!
The broth had lots of flavour however, we weren’t too impressed with the prawns. 3/5

Dessert: Flan de Coco
Underwhelming, didn’t taste of much. Highlight is the honeycomb.

Atmosphere:
Small and cosy vibe.
Music was a tad bit too loud, couldn’t converse that well.
Cool Latin American theme throughout the restaurant.
Toilets were spotless.

review_text:
I was staying at the hotel for work and came to the restaurant hoping for a quick dinner before a busy evening. Unfortunately, the experience left a lot to be desired. There was no one to greet me when I arrived, and I stood waiting for about five minutes before another guest kindly informed me I should just seat myself. I wasn’t given a menu and had to go to the bar to ask for one.

Service was very slow — it took a while for anyone to take my drink and food order. I ordered the pork belly and waited around 45 minutes before checking in, only to be told there had been delays due to a fire drill earlier that affected the gas supply. This hadn’t been mentioned when I ordered.

When the food arrived (after about an hour), it was just okay. The pork belly was unfortunately overcooked and quite dry. I had originally planned to stay for dessert, but decided it wasn’t worth the extra time.

If you’re staying here and hoping for a smooth, timely meal, I’d recommend looking elsewhere.

The food was acceptable, but the service did not create a pleasant or enjoyable atmosphere. We later received our food and waited an extra 10 minutes whilst eating to receive our drinks. I also received the worst pint of coors I have ever seen in my entire life, the head on the pint was paper thin and the pint overall tasted funny. The bartender agreed with me that the pint did not look right but didn’t offer me a new one just topped up the head on the same pint instead. When we finished our meal, I stood up as no one was coming to us to offer us a dessert menu and walked to the entrance where there was a waitress. I asked her for the dessert menu and she then begged me to sit down and said she would bring one to me. At the end of the night the waitress handed me the bill and asked me to please check the bill? I have never been asked this before, as expected the bill was wrong and I was being charged for items I did not order. She then reprinted the bill and asked me to check it once again. When I confronted one of the staff for the unacceptable waiting time she told me to “maybe book tomorrow instead”. This was not a great experience and I am very disappointed in the restaurant and its staff as the restaurant was not busy at all and I would not be recommending this restaurant to anyone I know.

formatted_address: Albert Quay, Centre, Cork, Co. Cork, Ireland
review_text:
During my stroll through the charming Port of Cork, I stumbled upon a quaint Irish pub that beckoned me inside. Eager to experience a taste of the local culture, I decided to stop in for a refreshing drink. From the moment I entered, the barmaid (server) greeted me with genuine warmth, kindness, and a helpful attitude.

Taking note of my curiosity, she attentively listened to my preferences and offered a wonderful suggestion: Irish apple cider. It happened to be my first time trying cider, and I'm delighted to say it was a delightful choice. The cider was perfectly crafted, striking a harmonious balance between sweetness and crispness that left me longing for another sip.

The pub itself exuded a friendly and inviting atmosphere. Although the bustling bar area was occupied, the cozy coaches offered a serene spot for me to unwind and savor my drink. Immersed in the authentic Irish ambiance, I couldn't help but appreciate the genuine sense of camaraderie and enjoyment that permeated the air.

This impromptu visit to the Irish pub left a lasting impression on me. The attentive and amiable service provided by the barmaid, along with the exceptional Irish apple cider, contributed to a truly memorable experience. I relished every moment, immersing myself in the rich tapestry of Irish tradition and hospitality.

If you find yourself exploring the Port of Cork, I wholeheartedly recommend paying a visit to this charming pub. Whether you're a cider aficionado or simply seeking a genuine taste of Ireland, you'll be treated to a warm welcome, an inviting atmosphere, and a drink that will transport you to good places.

formatted_address: E Douglas St, Douglas, Cork, T12 YP27, Ireland
review_text:
KC & Son & Sons is a Cork staple! It is definitely worth the drive to Douglas to go stand in the queue down the street from their door way! Their pittas are really worth it!

Staff:
The staff are very friendly here. They are also very attentive and get the order right everytime no matter how big your order is.

Food:
They have so many choices to choose from here with their Pittas being the main items that they are known for!
Some of their best pittas in my own opinion are the King Creole (Chicken), the Philly Steak (Beef) and my personal favourites the Angry Spaniard (Chicken & Chorizo) and the Kansas City Pitta (Pork).
The Angry Spaniard is a hot Pitta filled Chips, Mayo, Lettuce and topped off with Chorizo, Chicken and hot sauce!
Then the Kansas City Pitta is a hot Pitta filled with Chips, Mayo, Lettuce, sliced gherkin and topped off with slow roasted pork belly that is rubbed with their own blend of spices and coated in a homemade BBQ sauce!
Whats not to love!
They also serve really tasty burgers and they have the world of side options. These range from chips to Pineapple Fritters to their famous Chicken Bombays.
They have these huge bags too if you order a lot of food or if you need to carry your option in one bag. Handy to bring it on a picnic.

Queue:
Don't be phased by the queue here as sometimes it could be 10 people long and just inside the premises or 30 people deep outsode of the premises!
It does move fast and you won't be waiting any longer than 30 minutes to get inside to make your order.

Layout:
The new layout is much more efficient and it goes as follows: You walk up one side of the queuing area inside the premesis and at the top of this side you place your order, then turn at the top and you walk back down the other side towards the doorway and they will have your order prepaired and ready for collection juat as you go out the door!

Overall Recommendation:
I highly recommend calling to KC & Son & Sons as its a Cork staple! I always find myself here every couple of weeks and I nearly always find myself going for something different to what I ordered last time!

review_text:
As a themed and tourist heavy restaurant, I had high hopes for the Titanic bar and grill and I rarely give a review below four stars as there are so many factors to consider...Generally speaking, one category or another keeps things afloat. That was not the case here.

Food 3/5
The seafood chowder was somewhat flavorful and contained a good amount of seafood, but the seafood itself was unfortunately overcooked, giving it a texture similar to canned chowder. It was served with bread that was extremely dry and disappointing.
The other disappointment was the carrot soup. Also, served with a dry piece of bread, the soup lacked in flavor of any sort.

In contrast the burger and the fish and chips were both tasty well portioned.

Service 3/5
For a non busy time I would have expected that we would have had more attentive service. But the real dinger here was that servers could be seen hanging about the dining area chatting with each other and one of them was even picking their teeth (with their fingers) in plain view of customers.

The atmosphere is the winner.
The restaurant is quite nice and has such potential for a good evening out. If only the food and service matched it.

review_text:
Literally stumbled upon Buns & Dough the other night while driving home and I have to say its a hidden gem of a chipper in the Northside of Cork City!

The Staff:
The staff are very friendly and they keep the premises spotlessly clean. So much so we thought that they had already prepped to close down for the night however, they were still open for another hour.

The Food:
They have a standard chipper menu consisting of various types of burgers, pizzas and chips.
We ordered the Hawaiian burger and chips with some curry dip on the side.
The Hawaiian burger was fantastic! They add a rasher and a slice of pineapple along with cheese and their house sauce! To be honest I don't think I can order anything else now that I've tried it it was so good!
The chips are chunky and freshly cooked to order and their curry sauce was delicious. I already know that I'll be coming back!

Layout:
Its a standard chipper with the main counter and ordering area infront of you when you walk in.
The order counter and till are to the left and glass hot lamp is to the right of the counter.
There is no seating so you can't sit down to eat however, there once had for good.

Note:
The only thing I didn't like is that when I asked for a curry chip and for the curry to be on the side they charged an extra euro than the price on the board.
It was charged as a regular chip at €3 plus a side of curry at €2, where as the "curry chip" on the board is €4 (I assume the curry is poured over the chips).
Its no big deal as I can undersand from a business point of view they need to cover the cost of the tub.

Overall Opinion:
If you are in the area of where the Old Youghal Road meets the Ballyhooly Road and looking for a good quality chipper I highly recommend stopping by Buns & Dough!
Next time I plan on trying their Curry Cheese Chip and I will be definitely getting the Hawaiian burger again!
Solid 8.5 out of 10!

review_text:
Visited the Wool Shed Bar and Grill and they have a nice menu I went with the Chips and Pulled Pork simply because it was the only meal on the menu that came with chips.

Great staff great service and great food.

Would just add that if the meals came with chips as standard the meals would definitely be value for money and add more variety and would sell more.

formatted_address: 10 Lapp's Quay, Centre, Cork, T12 RD6E, Ireland
review_text:
My son and I stayed here for his birthday , he picked it out as the location suited and it has a pool . I had stayed here in the past and had a nicer experience. The online check in is handy but it found it confusing because there’s no information given about breakfast/ pool use etc . So I think that needs to be looked at . Receptionist was very lovely do and when we collected our bags she wished my son a happy birthday and dropped up a sweet treat which was the highlight of our stay ! The pools fab and clean and staff there are so lovely too .
Breakfast was surprisingly delicious ( we were affraid after reading reviews ) but we couldn’t fault it and staff were nice too !
The worst part was the room it was to y and internal , the window looked down to the lobby it felt so claustrophobic and with no fan in the bathroom and aircon it was so stuffy ! The rooms very basic and needs some extra touch’s and a deep clean !
I understand the hotel needs to use all rooms but I believe more transparency is needed for these rooms , the last time we stayed we had a fabulous sea view and it was the deluxe double room we booked then too .
Perhaps offer a discounted room rate for these internal rooms so people can decide when their booking as I feel I paid quite a high rate for this shoebox which I’m sad to say has turned me off booking the hotel again !
Also the area has gotten very bad around the hotel I know this is out of your control just feel I should mention it I wouldn’t be comfortable to stay with my kids there again either !
